name: Mrcore5
body:
# Welcome Mrcore 5.0 GitHub Pages.

Installation
```
# Prep directories
mkdir -p /var/www/mrcore5/{Apps,Files,Modules,Themes}
mkdir -p /var/www/mrcore5/Files/index/{1..10}

# Helper scripts
echo '/var/www/mrcore5/System/artisan "$@"' > /usr/local/bin/mrcore
echo 'echo "$@" | /var/www/mrcore5/System/artisan tinker' > /usr/local/bin/tinker
chmod a+x /usr/local/bin/*

# Clone mrcore5 repo
cd /var/www/mrcore5
git clone https://github.com/mreschke/mrcore5 System
cd System

# Alter environment variables
cp .env.example .env
# edit .env for your environment

# Customize modules.php
# You have to remove any modules from modules.php that you are not using
# manually edit /var/www/mrcore5/System/config/modules.php

# Compose mrcore5
cd /var/www/mrcore5/System
composer update
# Test with by simply typing mrcore, should see artisan help output

# Migrate
mysql -uroot -p -e "create database mrcore5"
mrcore migrate
mrcore db:seed

# Queue
I use redis queuing and supervisor to keep it running
apt-get install supervisor
cat > /etc/supervisor/conf.d/mrcore5_queue.conf << "EOF"
[program:mrcore5_queue]
command=/var/www/mrcore5/System/artisan queue:listen --tries=3 --sleep=5
autostart=true
autorestart=true
startretris=3
stderr_logfile=/var/www/mrcore5/System/storage/logs/queue.err
stdout_logfile=/var/www/mrcore5/System/storage/logs/queue.log
user=toor
EOF
supervisorctl reread
supervisorctl update
```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
